page.title: 04Farming, Brightwell Baldwin
page.content: Farmland dominates the area around Brightwell Baldwin and Upperton. Most of the land still belongs to the Roadnihts Farm in Britwell. However, Brihtwell Farm has been farmed by a local family for about fifty years. They were tenant farmers for the first thirty years, and then bought the land from the Roadnights arm in 1942. When they first bought the farm it was a dairy farm, but about ten years ago it chaned to a beef farm. the old, disussed milking parlour and barns can still be seen. The farm has about forty to fifty beef cows. The calves are sold in Reading market in the Autumn. There are three different breeds of cattle on the farm, short-horn crosses, Fresians and Herefords.
